titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Fowler Hopson Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr. and Robert Richards

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 08:46

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Correspondence, genealogical material, account books, and miscellaneous papers of William F. Hopson. The collection contains papers related to his many club activities, including the Acorn Club of Connecticut, Grolier Club, and Rowfant Club of Cleveland.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Fowler Hopson Papers (MS 287). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. W. F. Hopson, 1940.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in four series: I. General Correspondence. II. Invitations. III. Topical Files. IV. Oversize.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: William Fowler Hopson (1849-1935): artist and engraver; in 1870 moved to New York City to work as book engraver; in 1872 moved to New Haven, Ct., in partnership with Roger Sherman as professional engravers; engraver of many bookplates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, genealogical material, account books, and miscellaneous papers of William F. Hopson. The collection contains papers related to his many club activities, including the Acorn Club of Connecticut, Grolier Club, and Rowfant Club of Cleveland.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence arranged in alphabetical order.

did.unittitle: American Bookplate Association and American Antiquarian Society

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains invitations arranged in two sections: Hopson, William F. and Hopson, Ada W.
Each section is arranged in alphabetical order by the name of the organization(s).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains material arranged in alphabetical order by record type. Miscellanea is arranged at the end of the series.

did.unittitle: "Der Fries im Thronsaale des Koeniglichen Schlosses in Dresden:" Al Fresco Gamalt von Eduard Bendeman (Gezeichnet and Radirt von Hugo Burkner)
Specifications for machinery for compressing, rounding, or pointing wires or rods to form pins, needles or other articles of metal: submitted to the Office of Patents by Messieurs Hopson and Brooks
Indenture agreement between Messieurs Hopson and Brooks and Samuel Thomas
Grant of a license to use patent between Orin Lewis Hopson and Messieurs Johnson and nephew
